intro: Psychotria augagneurii, commonly known as the "Garden of Eden" plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking, velvety purple leaves and small, white flowers. The plant contains psychoactive alkaloids, including dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which contribute to its reputation in traditional and modern spiritual practices. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique chemical composition and cultural significance, it is both a subject of scientific study and a symbol of mystical exploration.
